Test Procedure: 1. (A/D) Logs in. 2. Navigates to "Create Patient Account". 3. Enters all valid patient details. 4. Submits.
Expected Result: System creates the account. Success message shown. Record stored in DB.
Actual Result: System creates the account. Success message shown. Record stored in DB.

Test Procedure: 1. (A) Logs in. 2. Navigates to "Create Doctor Account". 3. Enters all valid doctor details. 4. Submits.
Expected Result: System creates the account. Success message shown. Record stored in DB.
Actual Result: Doctor is created in DB but Doctor Cannot login

Test Procedure: 1. (A/D) Logs in. 2. Navigates to creation. 3. Leaves required fields blank. 4. Submits.
Expected Result: System does not create account. Error message appears.
Actual Result: System does not create the account. The form is not submitted as the button is deactivated.

Test Procedure: 1. (A/D) Logs in. 2. Enters invalid email. 3. Fills other details. 4. Submits.
Expected Result: System does not create account. Error message indicates invalid format.
Actual Result: System does not create the account. The form is not submitted as the button is deactivated.

Test Procedure: 1. (A/D) Logs in. 2. Enters existing username/email. 3. Submits.
Expected Result: System does not create account. Error message shown.
Actual Result: System does not create the account. An error message indicates that the username/email is already taken.

Test Procedure: 1. (A/D) Logs in. 2. Enters weak password. 3. Submits.
Expected Result: System does not create account. Error explains policy.
Actual Result: System does not create the account.

Test Procedure: 1. (P) Navigates to login. 2. Enters valid credentials. 3. Clicks Login.
Expected Result: System authenticates and redirects to Patient Dashboard.
Actual Result: Credentials are valid. System authenticates the user and redirects to the Patient Dashboard.

Test Procedure: 1. (D) Navigates to login. 2. Enters valid credentials. 3. Clicks Login.
Expected Result: System authenticates and redirects to Doctor Dashboard.
Actual Result: Blocked: Doctor account created in TC02 cannot log in.

Test Procedure: 1. (A) Navigates to login. 2. Enters valid credentials. 3. Clicks Login.
Expected Result: System authenticates and redirects to Admin Dashboard.
Actual Result: Credentials are valid. System authenticates the user and redirects to the Admin Dashboard.

Test Procedure: 1. Navigates to login. 2. Enters incorrect username. 3. Clicks Login.
Expected Result: System displays generic error message. User not logged in.
Actual Result: Credentials are not valid. System displays a generic message: "Wrong credentials".

Test Procedure: 1. Navigates to login. 2. Enters incorrect password. 3. Clicks Login.
Expected Result: System displays generic error message. User not logged in.
Actual Result: Credentials are not valid. System displays a generic message: "Wrong credentials".

Test Procedure: 1. Navigates to login. 2. Clicks Login with empty fields.
Expected Result: System displays validation errors. Form not submitted.
Actual Result: System displays validation errors for both fields.

Test Procedure: 1. Navigates to login. 2. Leaves password blank. 3. Clicks Login.
Expected Result: System displays validation error on password field.
Actual Result: System displays a validation error on the password field.

Test Procedure: 1. Navigates to login. 2. Enters username with changed case. 3. Clicks Login.
Expected Result: System behavior consistent (either fail or succeed based on design).
Actual Result: System behavior should be consistent.

Test Procedure: 1. Access protected page. 2. Redirect to login. 3. Log in.
Expected Result: User redirected to original protected page (/dashboard).
Actual Result: After successful authentication, the user is automatically redirected to the originally requested protected page.

Test Procedure: 1. Logs in. 2. Navigates pages. 3. Clicks Logout.
Expected Result: Session terminated. User redirected to login. Back button restricted.
Actual Result: User session is terminated. User redirected to login page.

Test Procedure: 1. Patient logs in. 2. Selects Doctor, Date, Time. 3. Submits.
Expected Result: System confirms appointment. Success message shown.
Actual Result: Available Doctors are not displayed.

Test Procedure: 1. Patient logs in. 2. Selects full date.
Expected Result: System displays "No available slots".
Actual Result: The system displays a message: "No available slots".

Test Procedure: 1. Patient logs in. 2. Submits empty booking form.
Expected Result: System does not submit. Error messages shown.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Patient logs in. 2. Selects past date.
Expected Result: System prevents selection or shows error.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Selects slot. 2. Another books same slot. 3. Submits.
Expected Result: System detects conflict. Error message shown.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Patient logs in. 2. Navigates to Dashboard.
Expected Result: System displays list of upcoming appointments.
Actual Result: System correctly displays 'Upcoming Appointments' section and count on dashboard.

Test Procedure: 1. Doctor logs in. 2. Navigates to Schedule.
Expected Result: System displays list of doctor's upcoming appointments.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. User logs in. 2. Filters for "Past Appointments".
Expected Result: System displays list of past appointments.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. User views list. 2. Clicks specific appointment.
Expected Result: System displays detailed info (notes, history).
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. New user logs in. 2. Navigates to appointments.
Expected Result: System displays "No upcoming appointments".
Actual Result: System displays 'No upcoming appointments' message on dashboard.

Test Procedure: 1. Selects appointment. 2. Clicks Reschedule. 3. Selects new date.
Expected Result: System confirms change. Old slot freed, new slot booked.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Initiates reschedule. 2. Finds no slots.
Expected Result: System displays "No available slots".
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Initiates reschedule. 2. Clicks Cancel.
Expected Result: System aborts process. Original appointment remains.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Tries to reschedule past appointment.
Expected Result: System prevents action. Button disabled or error shown.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Selects appointment. 2. Clicks Cancel. 3. Confirms.
Expected Result: System confirms cancellation. Slot freed.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Initiates cancellation. 2. Clicks No/Cancel.
Expected Result: Process aborted. Appointment remains.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Tries to cancel past appointment.
Expected Result: System prevents action.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Navigates to cancelled appointment. 2. Tries to cancel again.
Expected Result: System does not allow action.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Doctor logs in. 2. Navigates to Scheduling.
Expected Result: Doctor lands on scheduling management page.
Actual Result: Doctor is logged in and successfully lands on the scheduling/availability management page.

Test Procedure: 1. Doctor navigates to scheduling. 2. Adds new slots. 3. Saves.
Expected Result: System confirms update. New slots added.
Actual Result: System confirms the update. New slots added.

Test Procedure: 1. Doctor navigates to scheduling. 2. Modifies slot. 3. Saves.
Expected Result: System confirms update. Slot modified.
Actual Result: System confirms the update. Slot modified.

Test Procedure: 1. Doctor navigates to scheduling. 2. Deletes slot. 3. Saves.
Expected Result: System confirms update. Slot removed.
Actual Result: System confirms the update. Slot removed.

Test Procedure: 1. Doctor makes changes. 2. Clicks Cancel.
Expected Result: System discards unsaved changes.
Actual Result: The system discards all unsaved changes.

Test Procedure: 1. Doctor initiates edit. 2. Makes no changes. 3. Saves.
Expected Result: System saves without error or returns to view mode.
Actual Result: The system saves without error.

Test Procedure: 1. Doctor logs in. 2. Navigates to Follow-up Requests.
Expected Result: System displays list of pending requests.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Doctor logs in. 2. Navigates to Follow-up.
Expected Result: System displays "No pending requests".
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Doctor selects request. 2. Clicks Reject. 3. Confirms.
Expected Result: Request removed from list. Confirmation shown.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Initiates rejection. 2. Clicks Cancel.
Expected Result: Cancellation successful. Request remains.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Doctor acts on request. 2. Refreshes page.
Expected Result: List updated consistently. Request removed/marked.
Actual Result: Not Implemented

Test Procedure: 1. Patient logs in. 2. Tries to access doctor URL.
Expected Result: System blocks access. Redirects or shows error.
Actual Result: The system blocks access, redirecting the user to their own dashboard
